message.content:
cs.HC, cs.GR, cs.SI, cs.VR, cs.IR 

The paper focuses on the development of a novel approach for the exploration of large dynamic graphs in virtual reality, which involves the interweaving of two navigation metaphors: overview exploration and immersive detail analysis. This approach is validated through a performance evaluation and a case study with experts analyzing a co-morbidity network. Given the emphasis on human-computer interaction (HCI) and visualization, as well as the use of virtual reality (VR) technology, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). The paper also deals with graph theory and visualization, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.GR (Graphics), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the use of VR technology and 3D rendering engines could place it in cs.VR (Virtual Reality), while the case study involving the analysis of a co-morbidity network could suggest a connection to cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
